intro: Vincetoxicum sepium, commonly known as creeping nightshade, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant features dark green, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its berries, which are typically yellow or red, are toxic to humans and animals. Vincetoxicum sepium is often found in woodland areas and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
